title: S&P 500 drops 5% after Trump hikes China tariffs to 145%
description: The Dow Jones Industrial Average dropped 1,746 points, and the Nasdaq composite sank 5.8 per cent
excerpt: US stocks are giving back much of their historic gains from the day before as Wall Street weighs a trade war that has cooled in temperature but is still threatening the economy.
text: Even a better-than-expected report on inflation wasn't enough to get US stocks to climb further. | Representational1 min read Last Updated : Apr 11 2025 | 12:05 AM IST US stocks are giving back much of their historic gains from the day before as Wall Street weighs a trade war that has cooled in temperature but is still threatening the economy. The S&P 500 fell 5 per cent Thursday. The Dow Jones Industrial Average dropped 1,746 points, and the Nasdaq composite sank 5.8 per cent. Even a better-than-expected report on inflation wasn't enough to get US stocks to climb further. Losses for stocks accelerated after the White House clarified that Chinese imports will be tariffed at 145 per cent, not the 125 per cent rate that US President Donald Trump had earlier written about.  More From This Section
html:
Even a better-than-expected report on inflation wasn't enough to get US stocks to climb further. | Representational

1 min read Last Updated : Apr 11 2025 | 12:05 AM IST

US stocks are giving back much of their historic gains from the day before as Wall Street weighs a trade war that has cooled in temperature but is still threatening the economy.

The S&P 500 fell 5 per cent Thursday.

The Dow Jones Industrial Average dropped 1,746 points, and the Nasdaq composite sank 5.8 per cent.

Even a better-than-expected report on inflation wasn't enough to get US stocks to climb further.

Losses for stocks accelerated after the White House clarified that Chinese imports will be tariffed at 145 per cent, not the 125 per cent rate that US President Donald Trump had earlier written about.
